pages.description: Cover sheet for new detached ADU at 1232 N. Jefferson St., Placentia. Contains project description, governing codes, scope of work, general notes, sheet index, vicinity map, abbreviations, and consultant information.
key_content: Project description: New Detached ADU at rear of property (600.0 sq ft), 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, open layout with 9 ft ceiling height
Demolition scope: (2) 30 GAL outlets at back of existing main home to be demolished (195 sq ft)
Proposed covered landing & patio area (63.0 sq ft)
Governing codes: 2022 CBC, CPC, CMC, CalGreen, CFC, CEC, CE, CRC, and 2022 Orange County Amendments
Sheet index: CS, A1A.1, A1A.2, A-1, A-2, A-3, A-4, T24-1 (and additional sheets)
Separate permits list: retaining walls, swimming pool, grading, sewer, new water/gas, solar/electrical/plumbing plans
General notes: 18 items covering contractor responsibilities, 811 alert, utility clearance, smoke/gas valves, low consumption fixtures, dust control, storm drain pollution prevention
All-electric design noted for ADU

pages.description: First sheet of the 2022 California Green Building Standards Code (CalGreen) residential mandatory measures checklist. Covers planning/design, site development, EV charging, energy efficiency, water efficiency, material conservation, and environmental quality provisions.
key_content: CalGreen Chapter 3 — Green Building scope for residential structures
Section 4.106.2: Storm water drainage and retention during construction requirements
Section 4.106.3: Grading and paving requirements for drainage and erosion control
Section 4.106.4: EV charging requirements — minimum one EV-ready parking space, 40-amp 208/240V circuits
Section 4.303.1: Indoor water use fixture flow rates — kitchen faucets 1.8 gpm, lavatory 1.2 gpm, showerheads 1.8 gpm, toilets 1.28 gpf
Section 4.304: Outdoor water use per MWELO requirements
Section 4.405: Enhanced durability and weather resistance requirements
Section 4.408: Construction waste management plan — minimum 65% recycling of non-hazardous debris
Section 4.505: Fireplace low-emission requirements
Section 4.610: Operation and maintenance manual requirements for homeowners
Abbreviation definitions table: ACCD, CA, CBC, CFR, CPC, CRC, DW, EP, HVAC, LPA, MWELO, SCM, WF

drawing_zones.content: Chapter 3 Green Building scope and Section 302 mixed occupancy
Division 4.1 planning/design, abbreviations, Section 4.106 site development and EV charging
Division 4.3 water efficiency — fixture flow rate table, outdoor water use, irrigation
Division 4.2 energy efficiency provisions
Division 4.4 material conservation, Division 4.5 environmental quality, Section 4.610 maintenance

pages.description: Second sheet of the CalGreen residential mandatory measures checklist. Covers pollutant control, VOC limits for adhesives/sealants/coatings, formaldehyde limits, indoor air quality and exhaust, interior moisture control, and installer qualifications.
key_content: Section 4.504.1: HVAC equipment protection during construction — ducts sealed or protected
Section 4.504.2.1: Adhesives, sealants and caulks VOC limits per applicable standards
Section 4.504.2.2: Architectural paints and coatings VOC limits per SCAQMD rules
Table 4.504.1: Adhesive VOC limits — indoor carpet 50 g/L, wood flooring 100 g/L, ceramic tile 65 g/L, multipurpose construction 70 g/L, structural wood 140 g/L, contact adhesive 80 g/L (26 entries)
Table 4.504.2: Sealant VOC limits — architectural 250 g/L, non-membrane roof 300 g/L, porous material primer 775 g/L
Table 4.504.5: Formaldehyde limits — hardwood plywood 0.05 ppm, particleboard 0.09 ppm, MDF 0.11 ppm, thin MDF 0.13 ppm
Table 4.504.4: Coating VOC limits — flat coatings 50 g/L, non-flat 100 g/L, floor coatings 100 g/L, rust preventative 400 g/L
Section 4.505.1: Bathroom exhaust fans ENERGY STAR compliant, ducted to exterior
Section 4.505.2: Ducted range hood required for residential kitchen
Section 4.506.1: Concrete slab vapor retarder requirement
Section 703.1: Documentation requirements for CalGreen compliance verification

drawing_zones.content: Moisture/adhesive definitions and Section 4.504 pollutant control
Table 4.504.1 adhesive VOC limits (26 entries) and substrate-specific limits
Table 4.504.2 sealant VOC limits and Table 4.504.4 coating VOC limits
Table 4.504.5 formaldehyde limits and Section 4.505 indoor air quality
Section 4.506 moisture control, Section 4.507 environmental comfort, Section 703.1 verification

pages.sheet_title: (N) ADU Floor Plan w/ Schedules & Elect.
pages.description: New ADU floor plan at 1/4" scale with window schedule, door schedule, electrical layout, and extensive construction notes covering egress, fire rating, plumbing fixtures, smoke/CO alarms, and wall finishes.
key_content: Window schedule: 3 entries — SYM 1 (6'0"x4' tempered glass/insulated vinyl slider), SYM 2 (4'0"x4' vinyl), SYM 3 (6'0"x4' vinyl)

Door schedule: 4 entries — SYM 1 (3'0"x6'8" wood entry w/ security lock), SYM 2 (6'0"x6'8" wood French doors w/ security lock), SYM 3 (2'8"x6'8" bedroom door w/ privacy lock), SYM 4 (2'4"x6'8" closet door, no lock)
1 HR fire rated exterior wall per detail on Sheet 5, reference detail #1-1.3
Floor plan rooms: living area (open plan), bedroom, bathroom with shower, closet, kitchen, covered patio/entry
Wall framing: 2x studs at 16" OC, Type 'X' gypsum board, insulation noted
Electrical layout: outlets, switches, 3-way sensor switches, GFCI at counters, smoke detectors hardwired w/ battery backup, CO detectors, exhaust fans (ENERGY STAR), sub-panel
Minimum bedroom egress: 5.7 sq ft net clear opening, 24" min height, 20" min width, 44" max sill height
Shower/bath notes: cement board backing per R702.4.2, min 900 sq in shower, grab bars required per Jan 1 2026 code
Plumbing fixtures: toilets 1.28 GPF, lavatory 1.2 GPM, kitchen faucets 1.8 GPM, showerheads 2.0 GPM, dishwasher min 4.25 gal/cycle
Smoke/CO alarm notes: hardwired interconnected, min 20 ft from cooking appliance
Clothes dryer exhaust: max 14 ft duct length, flexible metal connector
Wall covering: 1/2" min GWB interior, 5/8" moisture resistant in bath areas
Kitchen electrical: outlets within 6" of wall location and 12 ft apart, countertop max 4' spacing, range hood min 100 CFM
Countertop outlet: first outlet within 2' of end of counter

Roof drip edge: extends 4" into roof and halfway down fascia face
R-15 insulation in wall cavities (blown-in)
5/8" Type 'X' gypsum board on interior face for fire rating
7/8" cement plaster/stucco exterior (3-coat), 2 layers grade D building paper

pages.description: First structural notes sheet covering special inspection requirements, seismic design criteria, concrete specifications, reinforcement standards, and general structural construction notes.
key_content: Special inspection schedule: reinforced concrete (CBC 1705.3, continuous & periodic), reinforced masonry (CBC 1705.4), structural wood (CBC 1705.5, periodic), soil construction (CBC 1705.6)
Periodic special inspection required for wood shear walls, diaphragms, drag struts, hold-downs; exception at 4" O.C. or greater fastener spacing
Seismic design: Ss=1.618, S1=0.618, SDS=1.405, Seismic Design Category D, Site Class D, Importance Factor I=1.0, Occupancy Category II
Basic wind speed: 95 MPH, Exposure B
Lateral force procedure: Equivalent Lateral Force Procedure, R=6.5
Concrete: 2,500 PSI min at 28 days, normal weight, W/C ratio 0.65 max, Type V Portland Cement (ASTM C-150)
Reinforcement: ASTM A-615 Grade 60 rebar, ASTM A36 Fy 36 KSI smooth dowels
Rebar cover: 3" against earth, 2" exposed to weather (#6+), 1-1/2" exposed to weather (#5-), 1-1/2" not exposed
All lap splices Class 'B' unless noted otherwise
Non-shrink grout: min 7,000 PSI at 28 days
Footings: min 12" below adjacent grade, min 1.5' below/above soil
All fill compacted to 90% relative density minimum
Roof live load: 16 PSF

drawing_zones.content: Statement of special inspection (5 items) and special inspection schedule table
Design criteria: vertical loads, lateral loads, seismic data (Ss, S1, SDS, SDC D), wind speed 95 MPH
Concrete notes (10 items): 2,500 PSI, Type V cement, ASTM standards
Reinforcement notes (6 items): ASTM A-615 Grade 60, cover table, Class B splices
General structural notes (9 items): 2022 CBC compliance, material standards
Additional general notes (items 10-16): footings, excavation, utilities, framing protection

pages.description: Second structural notes sheet containing the nailing schedule (26+ connection types), mechanical and adhesive anchor specifications, and structural wood requirements including lumber grades and engineered wood product standards.
key_content: Nailing schedule with 26+ connection types including: joist to sill (3-16d), stud to sole plate (2-16d), double top plates lap splice (16d @ 12" OC), double top plates face nail (16d @ 16" OC), rafter to plate (3-16d or 2 per Simpson H2.5), ceiling joist to plate (3-8d), built-up corner studs (16d @ 24" OC)
Toe nail installation detail diagram with 3/4" and 1" placement guides
Mechanical anchors: Hilti HVU 2022, ESR-3013, 70% U.C. for seismic loading
Adhesive anchors: ASTM A-193 threaded rods, ASTM A-563 Grade A nuts, ANSI B18.22.1 Type A washers
Adhesive dowels: ASTM A-615 Grade 60 reinforcing steel
Anchor testing: 10% proof tested, no sooner than 24 hours after installation, min 21-day concrete age
Structural wood: Douglas Fir-Larch No. 2 (DFL #2), select structural for beams/timbers
Glulam: Combination 24F-V8
Stud lengths: 2x4 at 8'-0", 2x6 at 10'-0"
Pressure-treated sill plates required, hot-dipped galvanized fasteners in treated wood
Engineered wood: Parallam PSL by Weyerhaeuser (ICC-ESR 1387, LARR 25202), TJI joists by Weyerhaeuser
Hardware: Simpson manufactured, Hardy panels (LARR 25719), Simpson Strong-Walls (LARR 25725)
Wood moisture content max 19% at placement

drawing_zones.content: Nailing schedule table (26+ connections with nail sizes and spacing)
Toe nail installation detail diagram
Mechanical and adhesive anchor specifications (11 notes): Hilti HVU 2022, ASTM standards, testing requirements
Structural wood requirements: DFL #2, glulam 24F-V8, pressure treatment, engineered wood (PSL, TJI), Simpson/Hardy hardware

pages.description: Partial foundation plan and partial floor framing plan at 1/2" = 1'-0" scale. Shows slab-on-grade with rebar, continuous footings, foundation bolt details, and floor framing with joists, headers, and shear wall references.
key_content: Foundation plan at 1/2" scale: 4" slab on grade with #4 rebar at 18" O.C. each way (detail 1/S2)
Continuous footing: 15" wide x 18" deep with 2-#4 bars typical
Foundation bolts: 5/8" with 7" embed at 48" max spacing, 12" max to ends/sills (detail 2/S2)
Concrete: Type V cement, 2,500 PSI, W/C ratio max 0.45, no special inspection required
Foundation washers: min 7"x7"x2-1/2"
Preservative-treated sill plates with galvanized/stainless steel fasteners
Epoxy dowels to existing concrete: drill & epoxy @ 12" spacing with Simpson SET 3C (ESP#4507), 8" min embedment (detail 7/S2)
Floor framing: 2x6 at 16" O.C. floor joists, 2x8 at 16" O.C. members, 4x6 headers at openings
Wall sheathing: 15/32" CD APA plywood/OSB, exposure 1, span rating 32/16, 8d common at 4"/6" edge and 12" field
Floor sheathing: 15/32" CD APA plywood/OSB, exposure 1, span rating 32/16, 10d common at 6" edge and 12" field
Symbols legend: shaded rectangle = wood shear wall per schedule on S2, circle with dot = wood post and holdown per 4/S2
All headers (VDS) to be 4x6 with trimmer stud U.N.O.

drawing_zones.content: Symbols legend for shear walls and holdowns
Partial foundation plan at 1/2" scale with slab, footings, rebar, and bolt details
Partial floor framing plan at 1/2" scale with joists, headers, and blocking

pages.description: Structural detail sheet with 8 detail bubbles: shearwall schedule, holdown/column schedule, slab edge/foundation detail, anchor bolt details, mudsill connection, footing sections at holdowns, DC footing connection, and ledger/wall connection.
key_content: Shearwall schedule (Detail 4): Mark 1 (5'-0" STR O.S., edge nail 4, field nail 12), Mark 2 (6'-0" STR O.S., edge nail 4, field nail 12)
Shearwall notes: Simpson HDU per schedule, common wire nails, special inspection at 4" O.C. or less
Holdown/column schedule (Detail 5): Mark 1 and Mark 2 with holdown hardware, anchor, footings, bolt, uplift values
Holdown notes: 7 items — hardware secured before pour, inspected before casting, min 1/2" grade 5 bolts, min 18 ga x 1" strap
Detail 1: Slab edge/foundation section — floor finish, slab on grade, vapor barrier, grade, foundation
Detail 2: Mudsill anchor bolt — P.T. sill plate, 7" min embedment, washer, bolt spacing per plan
Detail 3: Ledger/wall connection — P.T. 2x sill plate, anchor bolt, wall sheathing, foundation wall
Detail 6: Typical footing section at holdown — concrete footing with reinforcement, holdown bolt, wood post, 6 mil vapor barrier
Detail 7: DC footing — drill & epoxy dowels to existing concrete per structural notes
Detail 8: Anchor bolt/post base — wood post at sill plate, anchor bolt with washer to concrete foundation

drawing_zones.content: Detail 7: DC footing with drill & epoxy dowels

Detail 3: Ledger/wall connection detail

pages.description: Structural detail sheet with 11 detail bubbles covering wall framing at openings, roof framing connections, hip roof framing plan, stud wall framing, sheathing nailing plan, DTC clip details, and blocking perpendicular/parallel to joists.
key_content: Detail 7: Header at opening — 2-2x top plate, king stud and trimmer studs, cripple studs below sill; 8'-0" max opening = 1 trimmer, 12'-0" max opening = 2 trimmers
Detail 4: Roof framing — hurricane/seismic clips (H2.5 or similar) at all rafter-to-plate connections, rafters at 16" or 24" O.C., blocking between rafters, plywood/OSB sheathing
Detail 1: Hip roof framing plan — rafters from ridge to eaves, hip rafters at 45 degrees, common rafters at 16" O.C., jack rafters at hips
Detail 8: Stud wall framing — double 2x top plate, studs at 16" O.C., 4x or doubled header at openings, P.T. bottom plate at slab, blocking at mid-height
Detail 5: Sheathing nailing plan — 4'x8' panel layout, edge and field nailing pattern, blocking at unsupported edges
Detail 2: DTC clip max spacing table — single layer and staggered configurations, 10d to 12" / 20d at 12" O.C., blocks at ends with 3-16d toenails
Detail 9: Simpson DTC clip detail — connect with 4-8d nails, 5/8" min grip into blocking/framing member
Detail A: Blocking perpendicular to joist — 2x blocking between joists at bearing walls, 3-16d toenails each end
Detail B: Blocking parallel to joist — blocks at 48" O.C. max, 3-16d toenails each end

drawing_zones.content: Detail 7: Shear wall/header at opening with trimmer requirements

Detail 8: Stud wall framing typical section
Detail 5: Sheathing nailing plan layout
Detail 9: Simpson DTC clip installation detail

Detail B: Blocking parallel to joist at 48" O.C. max

pages.description: Comprehensive 6-column reference sheet listing all 2022 Title 24 mandatory requirements for single-family residential construction, covering building envelope, fenestration, mechanical systems, ventilation, water heating, plumbing, lighting, solar/PV, EV readiness, and battery storage.
key_content: Building envelope: air leakage/sealing, ceiling/attic insulation R-values, cool roof requirements, door U-factors, insulation certification, roof deck/rafter specs, wall insulation (cavity and continuous), vapor retarder
Fenestration: window/glazing U-factor and SHGC requirements, exterior doors, skylights
Below-grade: concrete floor insulation, below-grade wall insulation, raised floor insulation
Mechanical: pilot light prohibition, setback thermostat, heating/cooling unit efficiency, gravity venting, duct sealing (mastic/tape/aerosol), duct insulation R-values
Ventilation: whole-house mechanical ventilation per ASHRAE 62.2, kitchen range hood airflow/sound, bathroom exhaust (ENERGY STAR)
Water heating: water heater efficiency, pipe insulation R-values, solar water heating readiness
Plumbing fixtures: water efficiency requirements
Space conditioning: airflow rate across indoor coils, fan efficacy
Refrigerant charge verification requirements
Lighting: controls (dimming, vacancy sensors, daylight responsive), high-efficacy LED, luminaire power density
Solar/PV: minimum solar zone area, PV system size per conditioned floor area, battery storage readiness
Electrical readiness: EV charging, heat pump space heating ready, heat pump water heating ready
Energy Design Rating (EDR) documentation requirements
HERS verification references
49 total mandatory requirement items across 6 columns

drawing_zones.content: Column 1: Building envelope (items 1-12) — air leakage, insulation, cool roof, walls, vapor retarder
Column 2: Mechanical and ventilation (items 19-31) — HVAC, duct sealing, exhaust, water heating, plumbing
Column 3: Electrical and solar (items 32-43) — airflow, lighting, PV, EV charging, heat pump readiness
Column 4: Additional requirements (items 44-45) — light pollution, fenestration controls
Column 5: Energy storage and demand response (items 46-47)
Column 6: Compliance documentation (items 48-49) — EDR, HERS verification
